built_in_tools.name: codebase_search
built_in_tools.description: Semantic search tool for finding relevant code snippets and documentation across the codebase to understand existing patterns and implementations

built_in_tools.name: read_file
built_in_tools.description: Read file contents with line range support to examine existing code, configurations, and documentation for understanding current implementations

built_in_tools.name: edit_file
built_in_tools.description: Create new files or edit existing files with precise code modifications, supporting complex multi-line edits for implementing new components

built_in_tools.name: search_replace
built_in_tools.description: Perform targeted search and replace operations in files for making specific modifications to existing code

built_in_tools.name: file_search
built_in_tools.description: Fuzzy file path search to locate specific files in the project structure when building integrations

built_in_tools.name: list_dir
built_in_tools.description: List directory contents to understand project structure and identify where to place new components

built_in_tools.name: grep_search
built_in_tools.description: Fast regex-based text search across files to find patterns, imports, and existing implementations

built_in_tools.name: run_terminal_cmd
built_in_tools.description: Execute terminal commands for setting up environments, installing dependencies, running tests, and building components

built_in_tools.name: delete_file
built_in_tools.description: Remove files when cleaning up or restructuring the codebase during implementation

user_resources.name: tanuki-pycharm-architecture.md
user_resources.description: Comprehensive 539-line architecture document detailing the complete Tanuki-PyCharm system design including 127 expert agents, Cascade plugin integration, training methodology, PyCharm-specific tool orchestration, and implementation phases

user_resources.name: existing_tanuki_codebase
user_resources.description: Current Tanuki project structure with src/ containing core components like api.py, orchestrator.py, model_training.py, teacher_model.py, and web_server.py that can be extended for PyCharm integration

user_resources.name: cascade_plugin_integration_patterns
user_resources.description: Architecture patterns from the document showing how to extend existing Cascade plugin components like ProviderRouter, ContextManager, and FileOperations for PyCharm-specific functionality
